result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor Allen Nichols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's name.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Subject to random drug testing.

Comply with any conditions or treatment per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

DEFENDANT ENTITLED TO 1 DAY SENTENCE CREDIT IF PROBATION IS REVOKED.
